center.font: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

long-description.p: Overlooking Dublin city from the south west, at an altitude of 383m (1264ft), is a foreboding ruined hunting lodge, marked on Ordnance Survey maps as the 'Hell-Fire Club'.

Current urban lore insists on telling us that it was - and still is - a site commonly used for the practice of 'Satanism' and other occult activities, and that the Devil himself made a brief appearance there at some unspecified time in the past.

In a story similar to the one attached to Loftus Hall (a haunted house on the Hook Peninsula), a mysterious stranger seeks shelter on a stormy night, and a card game ensues. A member of the household drops a card, and sees that below the table, the otherwise affable and charming visitor has a cloven hoof. Her screams made the Devil "aware of her discovery, and he at once vanished in a thunder-clap leaving a brimstone smell behind him"
Whatever the truth of the matter is, there are great views out over the greater Dublin area - a good return for the effort put into the climb!
Please note that the cache adheres to the Leave no Trace Principle - details at this link

ul.li:
2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Cibak
There is nothing anymore. Cibak

2010-05-10T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by jdunne17
I think this one is Dead.

2010-04-27T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by colmyster
Second miss of the day. Looks like a local farmer may have been doing some work here. Hope the cache isn't lost...

2009-10-19T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Brocky88
Couldnt find it. Alot of Dirt Bikers around as usual so couldnt get a good look with out looking suspicious! maybe the Devil took it! I hear he pays the odd visit to the old Hunting Lodge! ;p

2009-09-05T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Grimes2002
Went looking for a long time. Could not find anything except cans and at one stage picked up a tesco bag full of rubbish thinking it was the cache. Boo urns. After that walk I was very upset :) . Graham & Siobhan.

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Montpelier
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Overlooking Dublin city from the south west, at an altitude of 383m (1264ft), is a foreboding ruined hunting lodge, marked on Ordnance Survey maps as the 'Hell-Fire Club'.

Current urban lore insists on telling us that it was - and still is - a site commonly used for the practice of 'Satanism' and other occult activities, and that the Devil himself made a brief appearance there at some unspecified time in the past.

In a story similar to the one attached to Loftus Hall (a haunted house on the Hook Peninsula), a mysterious stranger seeks shelter on a stormy night, and a card game ensues. A member of the household drops a card, and sees that below the table, the otherwise affable and charming visitor has a cloven hoof. Her screams made the Devil "aware of her discovery, and he at once vanished in a thunder-clap leaving a brimstone smell behind him"

Whatever the truth of the matter is, there are great views out over the greater Dublin area - a good return for the effort put into the climb!

Please note that the cache adheres to the Leave no Trace Principle - details at this link
